title: Drawing, "International Casino: First Floor Mezzanine and First Floor", October 20, 1936
medium: Graphite on tracing paper, ruled border in graphite
markings: Architect's stamp in black ink at lower right: DONALD DESKEY/630 FIFTH AVENUE/NEW YORK CITY; see inscription
inscribed: Architect's stamp inscribed in graphite: Job 546; 1/4"-1'-0; INTERNATIONAL/CASINO; G.H.W. / D.D. / OCT. 20/36; 12/3/36, 1, office. Inscribed in graphite throughout with measurements and descriptions. Inscribed in graphite at lower left: FIRST FLOOR MEZZANINE PLAN; at lower center: SEATING LEGEND [underlined]/FIRST FLOOR/14 ROUND TABLES 27" DIA. 56 SEATS/13 OBLONG TABLES 40" X 18" 52 SEATS/7 SQUARE TABLES 24" X 24" 28 SEATS/TOTAL 136 SEATS/FIRST FLOOR MEZZANINE/6 ROUND TABLES 27" DIA. 24 SEATS/5 TABLES (OBLONG) 40" X 18" 20 SEATS/TOTAL 44 SEATS. Inscribed in graphite center left: FIRST FLOOR PLAN; inscribed in graphite center right: REAR WALL ELEVATION/FIRST MEZZANINE FLOOR LEVEL; at right: REAR WALL ELEVATION/FIRST FLOOR LEVEL; below: SIDE WALL ELEVATION/FIRST FLOOR LEVEL. Inscribed in red pencil on verso: 1ST FLOOR.
description: First floor plan and first floor mezzanine plan showing central bar/spiral staircase at center of room, arrangement of tables, chairs, and benches around perimeter of room, and moveable rotating buffet in lower right corner (first floor). Indication of materials and placement of various lighting. Elevations showing placement of furniture, lighting, and materials.
